definitions.definition: The manner , pose , or posture in which one stands .
examples: The fencer’s stance showed he was ready to begin.

definitions.definition: One's opinion or point of view .
examples: I don’t agree with your stance on gun control.

definitions.definition: A place to stand; a position , a site , a station .

subdefinitions.definition: A foothold or ledge on which to set up a belay .

definitions.definition: A place for buses or taxis to await passengers ; a bus stop , a taxi rank .
A place where a fair or market is held; a location where a street trader can carry on business .

main_definition: The manner , pose , or posture in which one stands .
secondary_definitions: One's opinion or point of view .
A place to stand; a position , a site , a station .
( Scotland ) A place for buses or taxis to await passengers ; a bus stop , a taxi rank .
( Scotland ) A place where a fair or market is held; a location where a street trader can carry on business .
